title: Why Everything Converges - The Convergence Theorem

answer.short: Three axioms uniquely select division algebras; everything follows
answer.theorem: Locality + Causality + Discreteness => R, C, H, O
answer.proof: Hurwitz's Theorem (1898) - only four normed division algebras exist

key_results.uniqueness: Hurwitz theorem - no other normed division algebras
key_results.convergence: Any framework with these axioms MUST converge

coordination_connection.insight: Division algebra non-commutativity determines coordination bounds

implication: Standard Model is mathematically unique, not a choice

new_questions.Q633: Can quantum gravity be derived from O -> H -> C -> R hierarchy?
new_questions.Q634: What is the categorical structure of the division algebra tower?
new_questions.Q635: Does sedenion failure (dimension 16) explain dark matter absence?
new_questions.Q636: Can consciousness (Q19) be formalized as coordination in H or O?
new_questions.Q637: Is string theory redundant given Convergence Theorem?
new_questions.Q638: What is the information-theoretic meaning of dim(O) = 8?

status.Q39: ANSWERED - Three axioms uniquely select division algebras
